interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Mr. Magorium's Wonder Emporium
Review Date: 2017/07/19
Store: Dustin Hoffman  (Actor)    Rated:    G    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Science Fiction & Fantasy, Fantasy
Product Description: ['Product Description', 'In writer-director Zach Helm\'s whimsical 2007 film, MR. MAGORIUM\'S WONDER EMPORIUM, veteran actor Dustin Hoffman plays the title character, a 243-year-old toy-store owner who is ready to pass his enchanted business on to his beloved assistant, Molly Mahoney (Natalie Portman). However, when Molly, a former composer and pianist, has doubts about taking over the (literally) magical store, and an uptight accountant (Jason Bateman) appears to assess the establishment, the many inhabitants of the Wonder Emporium begin to rebel, resulting in a chaotic situation that can be fixed only with the help of a shy, lonely boy (Zach Mills). Director Zach Helm Star Dustin Hoffman, Natalie Portman, Jason Bateman, Zach Mills Special Features: Widescreen - 2.35 Audio: Dolby Digital Surround - Spanish, French Dolby Digital 5.1 - English Subtitles - English, Spanish, French - Optional Additional Release Material: Behind the Scenes - "Strangely Weird and Weirdly Strange: The Magical World of a Wonder Emporium" (Parts 1-5) Featurettes - 1. "An Eccentric Boss and an Awkward Apprentice" 2. "To Find Eric Applebaum, Start by Saying Hi" 3. "A Magical Toy Store" 4. "The Big Book of Toys" Trailers - 1. Forced Trailers 2. 20th Century Fox Previews DVD-ROM: Games - "Paper Airplane Tutor" Runtime: 94 minutes Year of Release: 2007.', 'Amazon.com', 'Equal parts whimsical and bittersweet,', "Mr. Magorium's Wonder Emporium", 'is a family-friendly movie that will charm youngsters. Dustin Hoffman stars in the titular role of an eccentric 243-year-old owner of a magical toy store. He doesn\'t appear to be sick, but he has lived a long and happy life and is content to leave his emporium to his employee Molly Mahoney (Natalie Portman). A former child prodigy who has grown up unsure of herself, she barely knows who she is, much less what she wants to become. Molly is both frightened that her beloved boss is leaving and that she will be left in charge of a store she doesn\'t know how to run. "Are you dying?" she asks him. Magorium points out, "Light bulbs die, my dear. I am departing." His take on death is both comforting and matter of fact, things younger viewers may find soothing when dealing with mortality. Though the film has drawn comparisons to', 'Charlie and the Chocolate Factory', ", this G-rated venture is less dark, curious and interesting than the former. Still, it offers dazzling visuals and a premise that who you are isn't equivalent with who you think you are. Adult moviegoers may find the premise cloying and repetitive. But seen from a child's eye,", "Mr. Magorium's Wonder Emporium", 'is indeed a magical place for a short visit. --', 'Jae-Ha Kim', 'Beyond', "Mr. Magorium's Wonder Emporium", "Mr. Magorium's Wonder Emporium", 'Books', "Mr. Magorium's Wonder Emporium", 'Toys and Games', 'More Kids & Family titles from Fox', 'Stills from', "Mr. Magorium's Wonder Emporium"]
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Aspect Ratio': '2.35:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'G (General Audience)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.63 x 5.41 x 7.57 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Item model number': '2250492', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, Dubbed, Full Screen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 33 minutes', 'Release date': 'March 4, 2008', 'Actors': 'Dustin Hoffman', 'Dubbed': 'French, Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'English, French, Spanish', 'Studio': '20th Century Studios', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: I'm a kid at heart...I love this movie. Very fun
Review Title: Great for any age
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
Basic Samuel Jackson (Actor), John Travolta (Actor), John McTiernan (Director) & 0 more Rated: R Format: DVD Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Sony Pictures Home Entertainment, All Sony Pictures Titles ['Academy Award(r) nominees John Travolta (Best Actor in a Leading Role, Pulp Fiction, 1994) and SamuelL. Jackson (Best Actor in a Supporting Role, Pulp Fiction, 1994) team up with action director John McTiernan (Die Hard, The Hunt for Red October, Predator) in a white-knuckle "thrill ride with a twist you won\'t believe!" (MairiAnna Bachynsky, ATV/CTV ENTERTAINMENT) Also starring Connie Nielsen (TheHunted, Gladiator), Giovanni Ribisi (Gone in Sixty Seconds), Brian Van Holt (Black Hawk Down), TayeDiggs (Chicago) and Roselyn Sanchez (Rush Hour 2). A DEA officer (Travolta) is recruited to investigate the mysterious disappearance of a famed U.S. Army drill instructor (Jackson) and a group of cadets on a routine military exercise in the jungles of Panama. But the journey to uncover the truth leads to some dangerous and unexpected places when two rescued survivors tell dramatically different versions of what transpired. "Totally mesmerizing." (Lisa Petrillo, WFOR/CBS (Miami)/EXTRA)'] {'Genre': 'Drama, Thriller', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Anamorphic, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Michael Tadross, Taye Diggs, James Vanderbilt, Arnie Messer, Giovanni Ribisi, Intermedia Film Distribution, Ltd., Samuel Jackson, Connie Nielsen, Mike Medavoy, John Travolta, John McTiernanMichael Tadross, Taye Diggs, James Vanderbilt, Arnie Messer, Giovanni Ribisi, Intermedia Film Distribution, Ltd., Samuel Jackson, Connie Nielsen, Mike Medavoy, John Travolta, John McTiernan See more', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), French (Dolby Digital 5.1), Unqualified', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 39 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '2.40:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'R (Restricted)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 0.5 x 5.25 inches; 1.76 Ounces', 'Director': 'John McTiernan', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Anamorphic, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 39 minutes', 'Release date': 'July 8, 2003', 'Actors': 'Samuel Jackson, John Travolta, Connie Nielsen, Taye Diggs, Giovanni Ribisi', 'Dubbed': 'French', 'Subtitles': 'English, French', 'Producers': 'James Vanderbilt, Arnie Messer, Michael Tadross, Mike Medavoy', 'Studio': 'Sony Pictures Home Entertainment', 'Number of discs': '1'} Love this movie! Great Lucifer: The Complete First Season [DVD] Tom Ellis (Actor), Lauren German (Actor), Len Wiseman (Director) & 0 more Rated: NR Format: DVD Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Drama ['Lucifer: The Complete First Season (DVD)', 'Bored and unhappy as the Lord of Hell, Lucifer has resigned his throne and retired to the City of Angels, where he is indulging in a few of his favorite things — wine, women, song. When a beautiful pop star is brutally murdered before his eyes, he feels something awaken deep within him – for the first time in roughly 10 billion years. Is he actually capable of feelings for a human being? The very thought disturbs him — as well as his best friend and confidante, Mazikeen (aka Maze), a fierce demon in the form of a beautiful young woman. The murder attracts the attention of LAPD homicide detective Chloe Dancer, who finds herself both repulsed and fascinated by Lucifer. As they work together to solve the murder, Lucifer is struck by Chloe’s inherent goodness. Used to dealing with the absolute worst of humanity, he begins to wonder if there’s hope yet. Maybe everyone’s got a chance for redemption. Even the Devil.', ']]>'] {'Genre': 'Science Fiction & Fantasy, Drama', 'Format': 'Dolby, DVD, NTSC, Subtitled, AC-3', 'Contributor': 'Len Wiseman, Jonathan Littman, Jerry Bruckheimer, Tom Ellis, Lauren German', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1)', 'Number Of Discs': '3', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 0.32 Ounces', 'Item model number': '35645241', 'Director': 'Len Wiseman', 'Media Format': 'Dolby, DVD, NTSC, Subtitled, AC-3', 'Run time': '9 hours and 20 minutes', 'Release date': 'August 23, 2016', 'Actors': 'Tom Ellis, Lauren German', 'Subtitles': 'French', 'Producers': 'Jerry Bruckheimer, Jonathan Littman', 'Studio': 'Studio Distribution Services', 'Number of discs': '3'} This is my favorite tv show of all time....and I'm no spring chicken.....I love to watch the devil learn and become more human(at times)....can't wait for season 2!
My package arrived on time and packaged nicely... Love Lucifer! profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Media Preferences:** The user maintains a strong inclination towards action, thriller, drama, and now incorporates elements of fantasy, reflecting an appreciation for whimsical narratives that blend supernatural elements with character-driven stories. They enjoy narratives that evoke a sense of wonder and childhood nostalgia alongside their usual focus on complex relationships and personal growth.

- **Favorite Actors/Directors:** The user continues to appreciate performances from well-known actors, with an evident fondness for Dustin Hoffman, indicating a broader interest in engaging stories featuring talented casts.

- **Format Preference:** The user remains committed to physical media formats, specifically DVDs, demonstrating a dedication to building a tangible collection.

- **Review Patterns:** They consistently rate products highly (5 stars) when satisfied, highlighting a strong likelihood of recommending similar content. The user expresses enthusiasm in their reviews and now also showcases an appreciation for children’s and family-friendly films.

- **Emotional Engagement:** The user describes experiences with a sense of love and emotional connection, emphasizing their enjoyment of heartfelt storytelling that resonates across age groups.

- **Longstanding Loyalty:** Since their initial interaction in 2017, the user has shown consistent engagement with various entertainment media.

- **Interaction Depth:** They prefer concise and enthusiastic reviews that convey genuine enjoyment while emphasizing their appreciation for quality storytelling and character development across a wider range of genres.
